Ken, I'm assigning this to you because the Task List needs to be more 
defensive about failures in Bugzilla.  But it could require Shawn to do a fix 
in Bugzilla as well.

This bug can lead to the loss of an entire task list.  It appears to be 
triggered by shutting Eclipse down while Bugzilla reports are still 
refreshing.  Fortunately I found a work-around so that I could restore my 
tasklist.xml from an earlier saved version: deleting the BugzillaTaskRegistry 
section from the XML fixed that.

Also, it made me discover that failing to load a task list can cause Eclipse 
to fail to load.  This needs to be addressed too.

Created an attachment (id=24809)
mylar.bugzilla.ui

update bugzillaTaskExternalizer to perform more checks, and withstand errors.
- if a bug report fails to load, an error is logged, but the externalizer
continues to read other bug reports

Created an attachment (id=24810)
mylar.tasks

harden the xml externalization for reading tasklist
- if a task fails to load, an error is logged, but the externalizer continues
to read all other tasks
- if an error is encountered, the externalizer will save the orignal xml, and
creates a tasklist with all uncorrupted tasks, categories etc. Then it writes
the tasklist to file so that it does not attempt to read the corrupt tasklist
file again.

Created an attachment (id=24811)
Mylar.bugzilla.ui - NEW

patch for bugzilla externalization

Created an attachment (id=24814)
mylar.tasks - UPDATE

added notes for TODO

Ken's part of this is done, there rest is internal to Bugzilla.  What needs to 
be done is that all refresh jobs need to be terminated, or gracefully 
terminate themselves, on workbench shutdown.  Otherwise on workbench startup 
it reads the corrupted file.

On BugzillaUiPlugin.stop, we now tell all of the refresh jobs that are still
running to be cancelled.  Also, there is some better error handling in the offline
reports file
